pros: Probably wage and WL balance
cons: EDI (Equality, Diversity and Inclusion) figures strongly in the university profile, but in practice, it is fiction. In fact, the situation is quite different, particularly for LGBT, women, and foreign staff, all of whom are subject to unchecked discrimination.

pros: Flexible and Friendly, generally a good culture

pros: it had a central location

pros: Good insight into research and opportunity to learn new skills

pros: Usually flexible work with not much pressure.
cons: Low salary. Especially considering the cost of living in Galway.

review_title: Should have gone to another country and university
pros: Galway is a nice city President seems nice
cons: - Ireland has the lowest PhD stipends vs cost of living in Europe - Forced to do free teaching until recently - Pay a student contribution fee that is not paid by PhD students in other universities - Dean for PostGrad studies has no sympathy for PhD student - very much an "I suffered so you can too" mindset

pros: Well connected network around Europe
cons: Students are left alone are living in poverty

pros: Nice place to work, enjoyable
cons: None that I can think of

pros: Flexi time Training courses Friendly staff
cons: Poor salary for qualifications required for the role. Salary 5/6 years behind inflation value.

pros: A robust research institution that provides all you need in terms of research support. Friendly environment and decent facilities.
cons: With the inflation and the higher cost of living in Ireland, the PhD student stipend is considered low.

pros: Small Uni but friendly place
cons: Rainy, poor transport links,especially air

pros: Top ranked university and very good working environment..

pros: Growth and Support available. Really lovely people!

pros: Is a nice environment with a lot of nice people and you will learn

review_title: University with a lot of opportunities

review_title: Exploited underpaid Ph.D. students and dodgy practices
pros: An interesting place to work with researchers from all around the world
cons:
- Paid a stipend (not a salary) which is less than the minimum wage
- Unpaid TA
- Lack of support and leadership
- unacceptable living conditions, particularly when it comes to accommodation and insurance for international students 
- Institutionalized greediness
- Galway is way too overrated than reality. It is not worth living there for even one month.

pros: The money is enough to live and enjoy the experience of being a PhD candidate (researcher). Nevertheless, depending on the type of research working hours may exceed expectations.
cons: There is no increase over the years.

cons: Most of the jobs opportunities do not exceed 2-4 years and the opportunities to improve your possition are limited.

pros: Best environment to work in the campus
cons: No as such cons that I can mention.

pros: Passionate people in some case (a lot of egos!!).
cons: I joined the University thinking that people would be driven by research, innovation etc. Unfortunately the people I worked with were lazy, clock watching and were always complaining. This is money funded by the government  for research to ultimately create new jobs. There should be vigilant monitoring by external auditors where money is spent and all money should be accounted for. Admittedly this is only a snap shot and there are some amazing passionate people working there. Do your research before joining.

pros: Working at NUIG gave me an opportunity to gain research experience on a variety of different projects with different people. I acquired a lot of skills during the four years I spent working here.
cons: I worked as a researcher on 6 different projects between 5 separate contracts over the course of 4 years, with breaks of unemployment between contracts ranging from 2 weeks to 6 months. There was no security whatsoever and very little support from management for possibilities of moving between projects or departments.

review_title: Please row back the crazy rules, procedures, processess
pros: Fantastic Location and great campus, some really creative minds and opportunities, lots of thinking 'outside the box' and opportunities to make things happen, interesting students
cons: Procedures keep changing and it's impossible to keep up, management use sledgehammers to crack nuts and that effects us all. So much depends on who your line manager is, the workload models and new IT systems drive us all demented. There is a real 'old boys' network, not all of whom are old ...

review_title: Low staff morale and toxic work culture.
pros: Nice city, nice place to live.  Many people within the university are great colleagues in spite of the work atmosphere rather than because of it.
cons: The university is run like an old boys club, gender discrimination and bullying are everyday occurrences.  The management of the institution have no insight into how low morale is and frankly I don't believe they care.  It is a toxic place to work.

pros: Supervisors provided good teaching material and were responsive to any queries. Also provided feedback and loaded with third directly on a weekly basis
cons: Lack of hours available for work. Students often submitted assignments late and plagued tutors with excuses for being late. Assignments were sometimes over challenging for students and they were not given a comprehensive outlay of standards expected

pros: For the most part had little to complain about, was definitely a big help while I was doing my studies to be working in something so relevant.
cons: Some bureaucratic issues, everyone was paid at a specific time of the month but if there was any error with your time sheet you may not be informed of the error until the deadline has passed.

review_title: Vibrant community with good opportunities  for career change or advancement.
pros: University culture is vibrant and meaningful, employees informed of organisational strategy and invited to participate, constantly changing to improve. Good communications, can see where the employer makes a difference through contributions to community, research etc.
cons: Area I worked was lacking in opportunities for career growth and lacked vision for development within the grade occupied. However have good opportunities to step into other roles outside of core skill and many people do this as form of career advancement.

pros:
Dealing with the students
Nice physical environment
Good Salary
cons:
Poor management at all levels
Poor moral
Poor work practices

pros: Lovely city. I can't find anything good to say about the university. Very laid back, to the point of never doing anything, in my experience. The only really good point was that, as an academic, I hardly ever had to be there.
cons: Awful atmosphere. Riven with politics. Nothing much of a constructive nature gets done. No support for academic staff. Bad facilities. Very little parking. Bad building provision. Awful red tape. Very low academic standards, a culture of pandering to students and dubious academic practices.

review_title: Very positive experience, a good University to work and do research
pros:
Nice location, international environment, academic excellence,good salaries, scholarships.
Galway is becoming a biomedical engineering hub, and therefore there are many opportunities for engineers
cons:
Irish weather, short duration of contracts for staff (non applicable for students).
Galway is a small town, anonymity is not an option, be prepared to know and be known by people

pros: I am working in this University for two year and I found here quite relax environment. There is nice infrastructure for research and the funding is enough in many research groups to sustain research.
cons: Not enough permanent position to get a job in the same university. The University brand name is not so renowned to get a job in other countries.

pros: Great environment, diverse and multicultural
cons: More needs to be done to make foreign students feel welcome and part of the university

pros: Working with young people keeps you young. On campus gym. On campus newsagent with special staff discounts on daily papers. Green campus with great gardens
cons: Parking is a nightmare. HR are not very helpful. Can be anonymous. Lots of red tape and layers of paperwork and admin to get anything worthwhile done

review_title: The city makes the university better
pros: Advanced facilities and equipment for research purposes. Nature-surrounded university. Plenty of space for outdoor activities. Great city to live in.
cons: Overall lack of organization. Extremely slow administrative work. PhD students are completely left at the mercy of PIs, have no real voice and are not protected by the university against excessive work.

pros: Nice staff and friendly environment
cons: Pay was a lot lower than I expected

review_title: Awful place to work, substandard for study
pros: Galway is a nice town, very touristy.
cons: The university is cliqueish, staff bullying is rife. The university describes itself as "student-centred". What this means in practice is that students can say whatever they like about lecturers, courses, and exams, and things get changed to suit them. As a result, standards are lower than in other universities, and lecturers giving exam information in advance to students is common practice.

pros: Good facilities, academics and research. Very friendly atmosphere and welcoming to new students especially coming from abroad.
cons: Nothing major. Can improve some of its websites and add more information about current research and future projects and research activities.

pros:
great students
great culture
small campus
easy to get to know people
good pay
great starting position 
learned a lot
cons:

mixed feelings there
a lot swept under the rug and not spoke about

review_title: Almost no administrative support. Very slow paperwork
pros: Relaxed working style. Great work-life balance.
cons: No additional support in terms of paperwork. Very slow and irresponsible towards employees.

pros: Mostly good environment with a variety of great people from different backgrounds.
cons: Poor senior management, rife with nepotism and internal appointments, as is standard in academia.

review_title: Poor management makes this place a unfulfilling place to work
pros:
Excellent work/life balance
Small town life style.
cons: Exclusive clique-y culture in my department makes working here pretty intolerable.

review_title: Cons = work environment - Pros = life balance - but not recommended
pros: Good salary, union representation, no fixed holidays, Galway is a lively town
cons: Autocratic and arrogant senior management, cliquey, poor middle management ability, bullying culture with discriminative practices - a lot of people seem quite unhappy and afraid. Difficult to work collaboratively as people seem to be continually jockying for position

review_title: Hard to cope with the weather
pros: I cannot think of any good thing. There were no benefits for employees.
cons: Terrible weather, poor management, loud and unrespectful students.  It's always cold inside the buildings.

pros: Facilities, Social Life, Research, Teachers
